definitions.definition: a member of the clergy, especially in Protestant churches.
examples: clergyman, clergywoman, cleric, ecclesiastic, pastor, vicar, rector, priest, parson, deacon, father, man/woman of the cloth, man/woman of God, churchman, churchwoman; Morecurate, chaplain; informalreverend, padre, Holy Joe, sky pilot "our minister visited me in the hospital"Morecurate, chaplain; reverend, padre, Holy Joe, sky pilot our minister visited me in the hospital

definitions.definition: the superior of some religious orders.
examples: noun: minister general; plural noun: minister generals

definitions.definition: (in certain countries) a head of a government department.
a diplomatic agent, usually ranking below an ambassador, representing a state or sovereign in a foreign country.
examples: ambassador, chargé d'affaires, plenipotentiary, envoy, emissary, diplomat, consul, representative; legate the Canadian minister in Egypt

definitions.definition: a person or thing used to achieve or convey something.
examples: the Angels are ministers of the Divine Will
her doctor was busy ministering to the injured
the story was able to minister true consolation

definitions.definition: act as a minister of religion.
examples: tend to, care for, take care of, look after, nurse, treat, attend to, see to, administer to, help, assist doctors were ministering to the injured
